sn30.2:1.2: “Mendicants, phoenixes reproduce in these four ways.
sn30.2:1.4: Phoenixes are born from eggs, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.
sn30.2:1.5: These are the four ways that phoenixes reproduce.
sn30.2:1.6: Of these, phoenixes born from an egg can only carry off dragons born from an egg, not those born from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.
sn30.2:1.7: Phoenixes born from a womb can carry off dragons born from an egg or from a womb, but not those born from moisture or spontaneously.
sn30.2:1.8: Phoenixes born from moisture can carry off dragons born from an egg, from a womb, or from moisture, but not those born spontaneously.
sn30.2:1.9: Phoenixes born spontaneously can carry off dragons born from an egg, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.
sn30.2:1.10: These are the four ways that phoenixes reproduce.”
